docstring: This is the minimal schema required to run the OpenSAFELY system smoke test.
All backends should implement this schema.

columns.name: date_of_birth
columns.description: Patient's year and month of birth, provided in format YYYY-MM-01. The day will always be the first of the month.
constraints: Must be the first day of a month

columns.name: date_of_birth
columns.description: Patient's year and month of birth, provided in format YYYY-MM-01. The day will always be the first of the month.
constraints: Must be the first day of a month

columns.name: sex
columns.description: Patient's sex as defined by the options: male, female, intersex, unknown.

columns.name: date_of_death
columns.description: Patient's year and month of death, provided in format YYYY-MM-01. The day will always be the first of the month.
constraints: Must be the first day of a month

constraints: Must be the first day of a month

columns.name: date_of_death
columns.description: Patient's year and month of death, provided in format YYYY-MM-01. The day will always be the first of the month.
constraints: Must be the first day of a month

sections.title: Defining a population

paragraphs.title: Population with single table
paragraphs.text: Extract a column from a patient table after limiting the population by another column.

paragraphs.title: Population with multiple tables
paragraphs.text:
Limit the patient population by a column in one table, and return values from another
table.

paragraphs.title: Case with case expression
paragraphs.text: Limit the patient population by a case expression.

sections.text: `set_population` is used to limit the population from which data is extracted.
